tutorial.title: Digital Business Card - Part 2
tutorial.descriptionContent: Now, we'll focus on responsiveness. We'll fine-tune our design, making sure it shines and impresses on screens big and small.

executableContent.instructions:
In the second part of the **Digital Business Card** project, we'll make more use of the CSS grid and make the card look great on smaller devices like smartphones, too.

1. Group your `h1` and `h2` elements in a `div` with the class `name-job`.
2. If you added contact details, group those in a `div` with the class `contacts`. If you haven't, add an empty `div` with the `class` set to `"contacts"` for now.
3. Set the class of the paragraph that holds a short description to `description`.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
When the device is too small to display the image next to the info, let's put the image on top.

1. Within the media query, add a rule for the `.card` class.
2. Within the newly created rule, add `grid-template-columns: 1fr;` to define one column instead of two.
3. Add `grid-template-areas: "portrait" "info";` to define the visual structure of the grid.
4. Last but not least, remove the padding on the card for smaller devices by setting `padding` to `0`.
